intro: Teline canariensis var. lanuginosa, commonly known as the Canary Island heath, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are leathery and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
